intro: Psychotria lanceolata, commonly known as the "arrow poison plant," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its most notable botanical feature is the presence of alkaloids, particularly the toxic compound psychotrine. This plant has been traditionally used by indigenous peoples for its medicinal and hallucinogenic properties.
